intro: Odontadenia cururu, commonly known as the Cape York nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, showy white or purple flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Odontadenia cururu is often found in open woodlands and is known for its nocturnal blooming habit.
